item.title: Skills to 1
item.dc:creator: @Sp3ke Sp3ke
item.description:
@Sp3ke wrote:

A better version, which will only work if all of you’re armour is removed. (Stops peope from doing it while still wearing defence-required-armour)

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("reset")){
int[] CBIDS = {0,1,2,3,4,5,6};
for (int EQ = 0; EQ < playerEquipment.length; EQ++){
if(playerEquipment[EQ] < 1){
for(REMOVE : CBIDS){
playerXp[REMOVE] = -1; 
playerLevel[REMOVE] = 1;
addSkillXp(1, REMOVE); 
} else {
sM("MESSAGE HERE");
}
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Skills to 1
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:
@Mercifies wrote:

I don’t think the moderators approved of my tutorial… Sigh Well, here we go.

Difficulty 1/10

  1. Go into your client.java file, then search the following:
        if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")

or

        if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master")
  1. Go below that and add in:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("allskillsreset") && playerRights >= 2) { // Credits go to Mercifies addSkillXP(-486000000, 0); addSkillXP(-486000000, 1); addSkillXP(-486000000, 2); addSkillXP(-486000000, 3); addSkillXP(-486000000, 4); addSkillXP(-486000000, 5); addSkillXP(-486000000, 6); addSkillXP(-486000000, 7); addSkillXP(-486000000, 8); addSkillXP(-486000000, 9); addSkillXP(-486000000, 10); addSkillXP(-486000000, 11); addSkillXP(-486000000, 12); addSkillXP(-486000000, 13); addSkillXP(-486000000, 14); addSkillXP(-486000000, 15); addSkillXP(-486000000, 16); addSkillXP(-486000000, 17); addSkillXP(-486000000, 18); addSkillXP(-486000000, 19); addSkillXP(-486000000, 20); addSkillXP(-486000000, 21); addSkillXP(-486000000, 22); addSkillXP(-486000000, 23); addSkillXP(-486000000, 24); sendMessage("All skills reset."); // Credits go to Mercifies }
That code is the code for reseting ALL skills. For Pure skills reset:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("allpureskillsreset") && playerRights >= 2) { // Credits go to Mercifies addSkillXP(-486000000, 0); addSkillXP(0, 1); addSkillXP(-486000000, 2); addSkillXP(-486000000, 3); addSkillXP(-486000000, 4); addSkillXP(0, 5); addSkillXP(-486000000, 6); addSkillXP(-486000000, 7); addSkillXP(-486000000, 8); addSkillXP(-486000000, 9); addSkillXP(-486000000, 10); addSkillXP(-486000000, 11); addSkillXP(-486000000, 12); addSkillXP(-486000000, 13); addSkillXP(-486000000, 14); addSkillXP(-486000000, 15); addSkillXP(-486000000, 16); addSkillXP(-486000000, 17); addSkillXP(-486000000, 18); addSkillXP(-486000000, 19); addSkillXP(-486000000, 20); addSkillXP(-486000000, 21); addSkillXP(-486000000, 22); addSkillXP(-486000000, 23); addSkillXP(-486000000, 24); sendMessage("All skills reset."); // Credits go to Mercifies }

That way if they don’t have any xp in skill 1 or 5 it doesn’t go into the negatives.

IMPORTANT: When you reset your skills, they will be shown as 99(or what ever level they are)/1. Your character MUST die for them to be reset. I suggest going to KQ if you have it or the owner uses the eat command on them.

I hope this helped

Read full topic
